result.execSummary:
The defendant Tracy L Botelho was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(SF) Case called at 1:57 pm
Defendant Tracy L Botelho in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Teuber makes sentencing recommendations.
Attorney Huebner presents sentencing argument.
Scott Skovalk Ms. Botelho's case worker makes a statement.

On each Count:
The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 90 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for work and treatment; to commence January 1, 2019 at 7:00 pm, concurrent to each other
--26 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

The Court orders that the outstanding costs and the alternate for failure to pay shall continue.

Recess: 2:12 pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 17, 2018 at 01:45 pm.
Information from Aurora Health Care submitted by Attorney Huebner at the 12/4/18 Hearing
Address c/o Milwaukee House of Corrections is removed.  Ms. Botelho has completed service of a jail term there.

[MK] case called at 10:18am. 
Attorney Karl E Huebner in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Sentencing After Revocation today.  Attorney Huebner submits a faxed medical-verification that Ms. Botelho has been recently hospitalized. She was discharged yesterday however she is unable to travel until December 10th.  
The Court and counsel discuss the adjournments in this case and that Mr. Botelho was released from custody while this matter pends; she no longer is serving time at the Milwaukee House of Corrections. 
The Court emphasizes to counsel that this matter needs to be finalized soon.  
recess 10:21am. 

NEXT:  reschedule the Sentencing After Revocation Hearing to December 17th at 1:45pm.
Deposit paid via gps
Attorney Huebner
cc: DA(electronically and certified copy) by COC on 10/30/18--ma
Proposed Order to Produce defendant - SAR - 12-04-18
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 4, 2018 at 10:30 am.
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK; no record is made ]  
This case is scheduled for Sentencing After Revocation today. Defendant Tracy L Botelho is in court, in custody.  ADA Monica Hall is in court, appearing for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court learns that Ms. Botelho is awaiting a response to her application for Public Defender representation. The Court directs the clerk to reschedule the hearing. 
In a discussion with the clerk Ms. Botelho confirms that she returned the PD application paperwork to the PD Office by mail approximately two weeks ago.  Ms. Botelho indicates that if she has not heard anything from the PD Office within the next two weeks she will have a family member contact the Jefferson PD Office.  
In a discussion with the parties regarding scheduling Ms. Botelho indicates that she is currently serving a separate jail term, so the rescheduling is not time sensitive generally.  She understands that time is needed for the appointment of counsel by the PD and for the appointed attorney to discuss the case with her and prepare.

NEXT:  reschedule Sentencing After Revocation to 12/4/18 at 10:30am.- writ is needed
cc: DA (electronically & Certified Copy)
Order to Produce defendant - SAR - 10-23-18
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 23, 2018 at 02:00 pm.
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 3:13pm. 
Defendant Tracy L Botelho in court, in custody.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court reviews right to counsel.  Ms. Botelho expresses indecision about whether or not to proceed without counsel to the Sentencing After Revocation hearing today. 
ADA Shock indicates that the State's recommendation will be for a consecutive jail term. 
After a brief discussion with counsel about the considerations with having counsel, Ms. Botelho indicates that she will apply for representation through the Public Defenders Office. 
The Court will reschedule the hearing. 
recess 3:17pm. 

NEXT:  Sentencing After Revocation on 10/23/18 at 2:00pm
cc: DA (electronically & Certified Copy)

There is no defense attorney present.  Asst. DA Jeffrey Shock is present in court representing the State of Wisconsin.
The Court directs the clerk to note that the hearing should be rescheduled and that a courtesy copy of the hearing-notice should be mailed to the Public Defender.

[MK] case called at 2:23pm.
 Defendant Tracy L Botelho in court, in custody, with Attorney Joseph M Ricker.  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Counts #1, #2, #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Counts #1, #2, #3 each the Court withholds sentence, and places Ms. Botelho on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--to serve 5 days in the Jefferson County Jail with work-release, on each count concurrent, to commence forthwith
--to undergo AODA assessment, treatment and follow through as supervised by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as may be required by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--not to be present in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to be subject to random drug testing 
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

Separate from the conditions of Probation the Court requires Ms. Botelho to pay costs and surcharges [clerk's calculation of the total that the clerk listed on the payment slip: $1,329] to the Clerk of Courts Office.  The Court grants Ms. Botelho sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in 20 days in the Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive 
Days credit for time already served:  21 days
recess 2:28pm
Duplicate Original Warrant Documents returned from JESO

Attorney De La Rosa appears for Attorney Joseph M Ricker in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not appear.

Attorney De La Rosa advises that the Clerk informed him that the Clerk's Office received a call from the Defendant that she was running late. Then was updated that the Defendant left Milwaukee at about 2:45 pm.
Court will stay a warrant until 4 pm to allow the defendant time to appear.
Attorney De La Rosa will wait until 4pm and update the court.

Cases 16CM99, 15CT529, 15CT505, 15CT475 called together at 1:31pm [mo]
Defendant Tracy L Botelho in court, in custody with Atty. Whitney Hagemann (for bond purposes only).   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Hagemann indicates that SPD is representing Ms. Botelho for bond purposes only.
The Court finds that each of the respective warrants have been executed and directs that they be removed from any database in which they have been entered.

The Court reviews the Court Record of each case
Explanation for non appearance given by Atty. Hagemann and Ms. Botelho
Bond arguments given by Counsel

Ms. Botelho gives updated address

The Court requires a $500 CASH bond to cover Cases 16CM99, 15CT529, 15CT505, 15CT475, with conditions:
--Ms. Botelho is to keep Jefferson County Human Services apprised of any place she is staying, regardless of whether it is a place she intends to live
--Ms. Botelho is provide the court with any change of address within 48 hours
--not to drive a motor vehicle
--no contact with Manuel Botelho during the pendency of this action
(*  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 

The Court gives Ms. Botelho her right to counsel 
--Atty. Hagemann informs the Court that Ms. Botelho has decided to seek counsel; Atty. Hagemann will conduct an eligibility evaluation

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

The Court emphasizes to Ms. Botelho the requirement to be in court on the scheduled Court date
recess: 2:16pm

NEXT: As to All Cases: Status Conference on 4/18/16 at 8:10am (Initial Appearance needs to occur in case 16CM99, bond has been set)
